data.title: Andy Atkins on LinkedIn: Blast from the past: our first real software design meeting at Jibo , held‚Ä¶
data.meta_description: Blast from the past: our first real software design meeting at Jibo , held at an invester's pool house somewhere outside of Boston, exactly 9 years ago today‚Ä¶
data.text:
How do you successfully create bespoke software for your business? Partnership! You bring the deep domain knowledge of the business, the sector you work in, how your organisation functions, the challenges you face on a day to day basis, the people involved, your team culture, your ops/sales/marketing/admin/finance processes, where your bottlenecks are, where your operating expenses are high etc. And a team like Rareloop brings design and technical expertise, we know what's possible, we're used to solving complex business challenges, we've seen what has worked for others, we're an outside perspective that can approach problems from a different perspective. Domain knowledge + technical expertise = success. P.S. This mindset also impacts how you source/procure design and technical services... but that's another post all together! üòÖ P.P.S This neatly overlaps with my earlier post about Rareloop's 'Teamwork' value https://lnkd.in/eiKEtwP5

It‚Äôs as simple as that. Start earning more of what you deserve, with Rolix üöÄ All Agents start on a 80:20 split, and after a company contribution of R140 000, move up to a 90:10. Want to hear more about our commission structure? Head to the link in our bio to find out more üè°

How does $600 in savings sound? When you register three or more people to attend Stronger to Serve, you‚Äôll save a minimum of $300 off the regular price with our group rate. Plus, if you register by April 15, you‚Äôll secure early-bird pricing for an additional $100 off per person.

With the ACA International Convention approaching, lot of in-person conversations will be taking place around collection systems, conversions, automation, implementations, and the topic of they year AI. No matter the size company, implementations aren't a 'standard' project. Planning, setting expectations and requirements gathering is critical for success along with resource planning if you are doing it internally, your busiest people will come even busier and making sure they are onboard and understand that is key.

"Looking for custom software development or offshore services? At TMS, we pride ourselves on projects like the Boondock Echo, showcasing our expertise in product innovation and development. If you need a dedicated team to bring your idea to life or scale your solutions, we're ready to help. Dive into the future with us. #CustomSoftware #ProductDevelopment #OffshoreDevelopment #BoondockEcho #Innovation"

My favorite VC Tomasz Tunguz ( Tomasz Tunguz ) can always be counted on for some interesting stats. Here is his analysis of revenue-per-employee for software companies between 2013 and now. It ranges from $200K to $900K - gulp üò∂ Where are you at? - https://bit.ly/3QX2EHu
